org.protune.core
Interface FilterEngine

All Known Implementing Classes:
ProtuneFilterEngine
public interface FilterEngine

The objects of the classes implementing the interface FilterEngine carry out every activity related to the filtering process of a policy.

Author:
jldecoi

Method Summary
 Action[] extractActions(FilteredPolicy fp)
          Extracts the actions contained in the filtered policy sent by the other peer.
 FilteredPolicy filter(Policy policy, Status status, Action request)
          Returns the filtered policy protecting the action, whose execution was asked for by the other peer.
 boolean isNegotiationSatisfied(Status status)
          Checks whether the overall goal of the negotiation is satisfied (i.e. whether it can be proved according to the current state of the peer).
 boolean isUnlocked(Action action)
          Checks whether the policy protecting an action is satisfied (i.e. whether the action is unlocked).
 

Method Detail

isNegotiationSatisfied

boolean isNegotiationSatisfied(Status status)
Checks whether the overall goal of the negotiation is satisfied (i.e. whether it can be proved according to the current state of the peer).

Parameters:
status - The current state of the peer.
Returns:
true if the overall goal of the negotiation is satisfied (i.e. if it can be proved according to the current state of the peer), false otherwise.

extractActions

Action[] extractActions(FilteredPolicy fp)
Extracts the actions contained in the filtered policy sent by the other peer.

Parameters:
fp - The filtered policy sent by the other peer.
Returns:
The set (array) of actions contained in the filtered policy sent by the other peer.

filter

FilteredPolicy filter(Policy policy,
                      Status status,
                      Action request)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the filtered policy protecting the action, whose execution was asked for by the other peer. The filtering is performed according to the policy available on the peer and according to its current state.

Parameters:
policy - The policy available on the peer.
status - The current state of the peer.
request - An action, whose execution was asked for by the other peer.
Returns:
The filtered policy protecting the action, whose execution was asked for by the other peer. The filtered policy is computed according to the current state of the peer and according to its local policy.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

isUnlocked

boolean isUnlocked(Action action)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Checks whether the policy protecting an action is satisfied (i.e. whether the action is unlocked).

Parameters:
action - The action.
Returns:
true if the policy protecting the action is satisfied (i.e. if the action is unlocked), false otherwise (i.e. if the action is locked).
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
